data.title: PennSound: S Press
data.text:
Search PennSound

S Press

Edition S Press, founded 1969 by Angela Koehler, Nikolaus Einhorn and Axel Knipschild in Hattingen near Bochum (West-Germany), was a privately funded small-press venture connected to a non-profit gallery. Angela Koehler’s brother Michael joined in 1972 and took over in 1980, running the label until his death in 2005.

The basic principle was to publish an international selection of works on audio-cassette and (many titles) reel-to-reel tape, produced in close cooperation with the authors.

Almost every work is spoken by the author, unless otherwise intended (works for multiple voices or if author is deceased).

Circulation varied with a maximum total run of around 300 copies in case of 'classics' (Raoul Hausmann, Otto Nebel) or 'stars' (Patti Smith, John Cage); this may not include later editions / re-issues.

The S Press catalog contains inconsistencies concerning alternative titles (e.g. Fast Speaking Woman by Anne Waldman contains the same material as Non-Stop); catalog-numbers (e.g. Michael Brownstein Brainstorms appears as #66 and #70); multiple catalog-numbers for one release (e.g. S Press Tape #27-28-29 John Cage Talking to Hans G Helms On Music and Politics); and alternative cover-artworks of re-issues. Some announced releases have never been published (e.g. Velimir Khlebnikov, Albrecht/d., August Stramm, William Burroughs, René Bastian, Reinhold Koehler, Rolf-Dieter Brinkmann, Bobbie Louise Hawkins). Even after in-depth research of the S Press papers (Archives of the Akademie der Künste, Berlin) and meetings with two of the original founders, Angela Koehler and Nikolaus Einhorn, these inconsistencies could only be solved to a certain extent.

If you are in possession of releases by S Press that are not listed here, or have any suggestions please get in touch with PennSound.

An extended introduction written by Marc Matter is available in PDF form: PDF

Contents

Note: Recordings are ordered based on number of first issue.

Recordings with multiple issues are listed here under both catalog numbers.

OTTO NEBEL - Zuginsfeld

S Press Tonband #15/16 | Excerpt released as #1 in 1970 as Zuginsfeld, Ausschnitt. Sechs Passagen

Published 1973; Recorded (this version) by S Press, July 30th 1972 in Berne, Switzerland.

Written in 1918/19; first publication in written form in Der Sturm, 1919/20

EUGEN GOMRINGER - spricht Konkrete Texte

S Press Tonband #13

Published 1973; Recorded by S Press in Hattingen, August 1973

Excerpts from the book konstellationen 1951–1968

Recording Part 1 - Der Dichter Und Das Schweigen (3:06): MP3

Recording Part 2 - Audio-Visuelle Konstellationen (25:09): MP3

Contains: Fliegt; Sticht; Zögert; Baum Kind Hund Haus; Kind; Worte Sind Schatten; Sich Zusammenschliessen; Einanderzudrehen; Regt Sich; Nahes Fernes; Kommt Hinzu; Bleibt Bewegt; Nimmt Vom Bestand; Stein Staub; Der Linie Folgen; Alles Ruht; Im Grünen Sein; Hängen; Vorübergehend; Der Grüne Baum; Das Erste Grün; Du Blau; Beweglich; Das Land; Aus Zufall; Der Einfache Weg; Rund; Vielleicht; Durch Das Trübe; 3 Variationen Zu 'Kein Fehler Im System'; Nicht Wissn

Recording Part 3 - Konstellationen in spanischer, französischer, englischer sprache und in schweizerdeutsch (13:31): MP3

Contains: Avenidas; Bleu Rouge; Rouge Bleu; Elle Est; Cars And Cars; White And Small; Spring Daisy; Americans; Small And Yellow; Snow; Ireland; Roads 68; Dörf I; Nimm Mi; Schwiizer; Wotsch; Chumm; Bisch Xii

Recording Part 4 - Das Stundenbuch (20:46): MP3

Recording Part 5 - Neue Texte (5:35): MP3

Contains: Das Wort; Einsam Gemeinsam; Erscheint; World Wide

JOHN CAGE - Mureau

S Press Tonband #14

Published 1972; Recorded by S Press, October 1972

The text was first published in a special issue of Neue Musik (Munich 1972), ed. by Josef-Anton Riedl.

For this work, Cage used his writing-through method on Henry David Thoreau’s journals, selecting fragments about music, sound and silence.

Used by kind permission of C.F. Peters Corporation. All rights reserved.

Mureau Part 1 (31:03): MP3

Mureau Part 2 (36:19): MP3

BERNARD HEIDSIECK - Poème Partition J / Carrefour de la chaussée d’Antin (extrait)

S Press Tonband #18 | Carrefour de la chaussée d’Antin extracts reissued as S Press Tape #23

Published 1973

Poème Partition J dates from 1961 and was first publishd on vinyl in Revue OU 23/24.

The whole Carrefour de la Chauss d’Antin lasts for one hour and forty minutes; this tape presents six extracts, they are Pass-Partout No. 10, 13, 15, 16, 20 and 21.

MP3 Unavailable due to restrictions by heirs

For internal use only: link

JOHN CAGE - John Cage talking to Hans G Helms On Music And Politics

S Press Tape #27/28/29

Published 1975

The interview on this tape was conducted by Helms at Cage’s Manhattan apartment on April 7th, 1972 during the production of the TV-Special Birdcage / 73'20.958'' for a Composer (commissioned by WDR / SWR, written and directed by Helms) in honour of Cage’s 60th birthday.

Conversation with Hans G. Helm (1:46:33): MP3

ARMAND SCHWERNER - The Tablets I–XVIII

S Press Tape #30/31

Published 1975

The text was first published by Grossman Publishers, New York, 1971

The Tablets I-X (51:40): MP3

BRION GYSIN - The Brion Gysin Show. Where Is That Word

S Press Tape #32

Published 1975

For this tape production, the BBC program The Permutated Poems of Brion Gysin have been combined by Gysin with with additional materials in order to make up a coherent sound track and a consistent demonstration of his poetic investigations.

Where Is That Word? (32:36): MP3

JACKSON MACLOW - The Eight-Voice Stereo-Canon Realization (11/25/73 [alternate: For Kathy Acker]) Of "The Black Tarantula Crossword Gathas"

S Press Tape #33

Published 1975

The text was written (drawn) on August 25, 1973

The recording was produced at the New York University Composers’ Workshop (Manhattan) on November 25, 1973

8 Voice Stereo Canon (the 4 overlaid performances begin on channel one about 20 sec after they begin on channel 2: a 4-against-4 canon) by Jackson MacLow

Complete recording (32:42): MP3

GERHARD RÜHM - Litaneien

S Press Tonband #34/35

Published 1975

The texts are based on the book Wahnsinn – Litaneien, Munich 1973

Litaneien (41:46): MP3

Contains: 1.Glaubensbekenntnis; 2.Lebenslauf; 3.Sinngedicht; 4.Annäherung

POETISCHE TEXTE VON QUARTANERINNEN - Gedichte sind gemalte Fensterscheiben

S Press Tonband #36

Published 1975; Recorded by S Press, summer 1974

Texts written and performed by pupils of the 7th grade of the Luisengymnasium high school, Düsseldorf. These texts are 'Sprachspiele' (language games) that were created as a response to the language norm that is/was obligatory in all subjects at school. Over the years, the authors have developed poetic techniques outside the classroom, independently and without being aware of literary models.

Gedichte sind gemalte Fensterscheiben (22:16): MP3

Voices / Authors in order of appearance: 1. Sorana Gronich et.al; 2. Petra Molis; 3. Rebecca Saueressig; 4. Ingeborg Mackenthum; 5. Martina Klein; 6. Bärbel Stadler; Gabriele Bienroth; 8. Sorana Gronich; 9. Birgit Engstler

GERHARD RÜHM - Wiener Dialektgedichte (1975)

S Press Tonband #46/47

Published 1975

Written versions in Gesammelte Gedichte und visuelle Texte (1970)

In the macabre Dialektgedichten, Rühm uses the phrase-like manner of dialect, an area of language long unused by poetry, in order to achieve new effects through the unusual confrontation of terms.

ERNST JANDL - Aus der Fremde. Eine Sprechoper in 7 Szenen

S Press Tonbandverlag #52 | Reissued as #86

Published 1980

The featured recording, spoken by Ernst Jandl himself, was made in the second half of 1978 in the course of the elaboration of the piece and first served as a self-control by the author. Therefore the sound quality does not correspond to studio recordings and the text contains some minor deviations from the final version.

(Additionally, a radio play (Hörspielfassung) with the voices of three actors was produced by Westdeutscher Rundfunk / Hessischer Rundfunk, not included on this cassette, later released on CD by Gertraud Scholz Verlag)
